brief_summary.textblock: QUDOS is a cross-sectional population study aiming to answer key questions about diabetes and its complications in Qatar as well as identify factors associated with the development and progression of diabetes complications.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the relationships between T2DM and blood glucose through a blood sample
primary_outcome.description: Our primary analyses will be conducted to explore the potential cross-sectional and longitudinal relationships between T2DM and blood glucose through a blood sample

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the relationships between T2DM and lipid levels through a blood sample

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the relationships between T2DM and depression through questionnaires
To assess the relationships between T2DM and sleep disordered breathing, sleep duration and sleep quality through a home sleep study
To assess the relationships between T2DM and physical activity using an Actiwatch

arm_group.description: Aims to recruit 1,700 diabetic patients (including 200 with type 1 diabetes mellitus (independent of healthcare setting)) attending the hospitals and primary care
To further characterise 500 patients, from the total 1500 patients with T2DM recruited in QUDOS 1, who accept to continue with QUDOS 2 (a more detailed study and assessment).

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood, urine, saliva and stool samples

study_pop.textblock:
Adult patients 18-70 years old with diabetes, who are a resident in Qatar or born in one of the MENA countries with family originating from MENA countries, will be recruited from one of the following sites:
- Primary health care centers
- Hamad General Hospital
- Al-Wakra Hospital
- Al-Khor Hospital
